sentences.en: ‘Has he got any experience?’ ‘No, but he’s keen to learn.’
sentences.cn: “他有经验吗？”“没有，但他非常好学。”

sentences.en: A miracle is something that seems impossible but happens anyway.
sentences.cn: 奇迹就是看似不可能，却发生了。

sentences.en: an expensive but extremely useful book
sentences.cn: 价钱很贵却是非常有用的一本书

sentences.en: Before the race, he is fine. But afterwards he is worn out.
sentences.cn: 赛前他状态很好，赛后就筋疲力尽了。

sentences.en: But legal experts are not sure if such a charge can stick.
sentences.cn: 但法律专家们不能肯定这一指控是否成立。

sentences.en: English has hurt me a thousand times, but I still regard it as my first love.
sentences.cn: 英语伤我千百遍，我待英语如初恋。

sentences.en: For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbours, and laugh at them in our turn?
sentences.cn: 我们活着是为了什么？不就是给邻居当笑柄，再反过来笑他们。

sentences.en: He waited until all the luggage was cleared, but Paula's never appeared.
sentences.cn: 他一直等到所有的行李都拿走了，但始终没看见葆拉的。

sentences.en: He was a stern critic but an extremely kindly man.
sentences.cn: 他是个苛刻的批评家，但却是个非常善良的人。

sentences.en: I tried to reach the foot brakes but I couldn't.
sentences.cn: 我试图去够脚刹，但是没能踩到。

sentences.en: I walked along Broadway, deserted but for the occasional cab.
sentences.cn: 我沿着百老汇走，街上除了偶尔经过的出租车几乎空无一人。

sentences.en: it's a very hard match, but then they all are.
sentences.cn: 这是一场硬仗，不过所有比赛都如此。

sentences.en: It’s an old car, but it’s very reliable.
sentences.cn: 这是一辆旧车，但是性能非常可靠。

sentences.en: It's an uphill battle but I think we're going to win.
sentences.cn: 虽然这是一场艰苦的斗争，但我相信我们会取得胜利。

sentences.en: It’s going to be difficult. Anyway, we can but try.
sentences.cn: 这将会很难，但是无论如何，我们只能试试。

sentences.en: The crowd in Robinson's Coffee-House was thinning, but only by degrees.
sentences.cn: 鲁宾逊咖啡屋里的人正在变少，但也只是渐少而已。

sentences.en: The happiest are not those who own all the best things, but those who can appreciate the beauty of life.
sentences.cn: 最幸福的人们并不一定什么都是最好，只是他们懂得欣赏生活的美好。

sentences.en: These expressions are often used interchangeably, but they do have different meanings.
sentences.cn: 这些表达方式经常相互替代使用，但它们的含义却有所不同。

sentences.en: They rushed to the hospital, but they were too late.
sentences.cn: 他们急忙赶到医院，但是已经太迟了。

sentences.en: This is but one example of what can happen when things go badly wrong.
sentences.cn: 倒霉的时候就会发生这样的事，这只不过是其中一例。

sentences.en: We don't live in the lap of luxury, but we're comfortable.
sentences.cn: 我们的生活虽然并非锦衣玉食，也算是衣食无忧。

sentences.en: We have relationships of many different sorts – with our children, our parents, our boss and our friends, to name but a few.
sentences.cn: 我们有各式各样的人际关系——和子女的关系、和父母的关系、和老板的关系以及和朋友的关系，这些只是其中的几类。

sentences.en: We’ve invited the boss, but she may decide not to come.
sentences.cn: 我们邀请过老板，但她有可能决定不来。

sentences.en: Well, so much for the producers. But what of the con-sumers?
sentences.cn: 好吧，关于生产商就讲这么多，那关于消费者呢？

sentences.en: who knows but that the pictures painted on air are eternal.
sentences.cn: 谁能说空中描绘的东西不能是永恒的呢？。

sentences.en: You could never eliminate risk, but preparation and training could attenuate it.
sentences.cn: 风险不可能完全消除，但可以通过防范和培训来降低。

phrases.tran_cn: [美国口语]彻底地，完全；狠狠地；有力地；毫无疑问

trans.tran_en: used to connect two statements or phrases when the second one adds something different or seems surprising after the first one
used to emphasize a word or statement
used to connect two statements or phrases when the second one adds something different or seems surprising after the first one
